Detailed Description

This file contains the function prototypes for Mailbox access.

Function Documentation

void MailboxClrNewMsgStatus ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  userId,
uint32_t  queueId 
)

This function clears the queue not-full status.

Parameters
baseAddrIt is the Memory address of the Mailbox instance.
userIdUser for whom the event should be cleared
queueIdQueue for which the event should be cleared
Returns
None
void MailboxClrQueueNotFullStatus ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  userId,
uint32_t  queueId 
)

This function clears the queue not-full status.

Parameters
baseAddrIt is the Memory address of the Mailbox instance.
userIdUser for whom the event should be cleared
queueIdQueue for which the event should be cleared
Returns
None
void MailboxConfigIdleMode ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  idleMode 
)

This function configures the idle mode of the mailbox.

Parameters
baseAddrIt is the Memory address of the Mailbox instance.
idleModeIdle mode to be configured. Possible values are 0x0: Force-idle. An idle request is acknowledged unconditionally 0x1: No-idle. An idle request is never acknowledged 0x2: Smart-idle. Acknowledgement to an idle request is given based on the internal activity of the module
Returns
None
void MailboxDisableNewMsgInt ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  userId,
uint32_t  queueId 
)

This function disables the new message interrupt for a user for given queue.

Parameters
baseAddrIt is the Memory address of the Mailbox instance.
userIdUser for whom the new message event should be disabled
queueIdQueue to be monitored for new message
Returns
None
void MailboxDisableQueueNotFullInt ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  userId,
uint32_t  queueId 
)

This function disables the queue not full interrupt for a user for given queue.

Parameters
baseAddrIt is the Memory address of the Mailbox instance.
userIdUser for whom the event should be disabled
queueIdQueue for which the non-full event to be disabled
Returns
None
void MailboxEnableNewMsgInt ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  userId,
uint32_t  queueId 
)

This function enables the new message interrupt for a user for given queue.

Parameters
baseAddrIt is the Memory address of the Mailbox instance.
userIdUser for whom the new message should be intimated
queueIdQueue to be monitored for new message
Returns
None

uint32_t  userId,
uint32_t  queueId 
)

This function enables the queue not full interrupt for a user for given queue.

Parameters

userIdUser for whom the event should be intimated
queueIdQueue to be monitored for non-full condition

None
uint32_t MailboxGetIrqEnableStatus ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  userId,
uint32_t  queueId 
)

This function gets IRQ enable status.

Parameters
baseAddrIt is the Memory address of the Mailbox instance.
userIdUser for whom the event should be checked
queueIdQueue for which the event should be checked
Returns
status Queue not full status
uint32_t MailboxGetMessage ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  queueId,
uint32_t *  msgPtr 
)

This function gets the first message in the queue.

Parameters
baseAddrIt is the Memory address of the Mailbox instance.
queueIdQueue to be read
*msgPtrMessage pointer in which the message will be returned
Returns
Validity The return value indicates whether the message is valid
uint32_t MailboxGetMessageCount ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  queueId 
)

This function gets message count in the mailbox.

Parameters
baseAddrIt is the Memory address of the Mailbox instance.
queueIdMailbox FIFO id
Returns
status Queue not full status

Returns

void MailboxReset ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

This function resets the mailbox.

Parameters
baseAddrIt is the Memory address of the Mailbox instance. MAILBOXn (n = 1 to 10) Ex MAILBOX1, MAILBOX2, etc EVEn_MLBm (n = 1 to 3, m = 1 to 4)
Returns
None
uint32_t MailboxSendMessage ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  queueId,
uint32_t  msg 
)

This function writes message in the queue.

Parameters
baseAddrIt is the Memory address of the Mailbox instance.
queueIdQueue to be written
msgMessage to be sent
Returns
status The return value indicates whether the message is written to the queue. Possible values are, 0 - Written successfully 0 - Queue full
void MailboxWriteEOI ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  value 
)

This function writes EOI register.

Parameters
baseAddrIt is the Memory address of the Mailbox instance.
valueUser for whom the event should be checked
Returns
None
